bodyPart.description: The muscles around the spine are smaller, so the focus is on endurance. Thus the strengthening exercises are performed for a greater number of reps or time, instead of adding weight. Also, remember to keep a neutral spine during these strengthening exercises!

childrenExerciseStretching.title: Rotations
childrenExerciseStretching.description: 3 x 5. Use foam roller under knee to keep spine stable. Limit rotation of body while keeping eyes on fingertips.

childrenExerciseStretching.title: Wall Slides
childrenExerciseStretching.description: 3 x 5. Slide arms up while keeping arms and back in contact with wall as much as possible.

childrenExerciseStretching.title: Standing Wall Extensions
childrenExerciseStretching.description: 3 x 5 or hold for 30-45 sec. Keep arms fixed on the wall.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Supermans
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10 or hold for 45-60 sec. Don't go into hyperextension. Only lift arms, lift both arms and legs, or lift opposite arm and leg.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Bird Dog
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10 each. Lift single arm, single leg, or opposite arm and leg.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Good Mornings
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10. Keep neutral spine, up to 90 degrees.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Cat Cows
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10 each. Start from flat back,
